conclusion: Need to analyze v-t graph to determine acceleration changes.
x-axis represents time, y-axis represents velocity, two curves labeled A and B, both start at origin and end at (t1, 0).
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, represented by slope of tangent on v-t graph.
At time 0, slope of curve A is positive and increasing.
As time increases, slope of curve A becomes less steep, indicating acceleration decreases.
At some point, slope of curve A becomes zero, meaning acceleration is zero.
After slope becomes zero, it becomes negative and increases, indicating acceleration becomes more negative.
As time approaches t1, slope of curve A becomes more negative, indicating higher deceleration.
At time 0, slope of curve B is positive and increasing.
As time increases, slope of curve B becomes less steep, indicating acceleration decreases.
At some point, slope of curve B becomes zero, meaning acceleration is zero.
After slope becomes zero, it becomes negative and increases, indicating acceleration becomes more negative.
As time approaches t1, slope of curve B becomes more negative, indicating higher deceleration.
For both curves A and B, slopes initially increase, then decrease, and finally become more negative.
Accelerations of both objects A and B are first increasing and then decreasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
